pullRequest.body:
**RingTheory/HopkinsLevitzki.lean** (new file): the Hopkins--Levitzki theorem says a module over a semiprimary ring is Noetherian iff it's Artinian (iff it's of finite length). As a consequence, a (left) Artinian ring is also (left) Noetherian, and a commutative ring is Artinian iff it's Noetherian and has Krull dimension 0.

**RingTheory/Jacobson/Semiprimary.lean** (new file): contains the definition of semiprimary rings, and connections between Jacobson radicals of modules and semisimplicity.

**RingTheory/Jacobson/Radical.lean** (new file): develop the theory of Jacobson radicals of modules, including versions of Nakayama's lemma over noncommutative rings.

**RingTheory/Artinian/Module.lean**: show an Artinian module or ring is semisimple iff it has trivial radical; show that an Artinian ring is semiprimary.

---

- [x] depends on: #21544

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

```bash

./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2994a6e3-d37f-4bb7-b8d7-d3db06a72ed0) for commit cfe9acc75a8355b45f16a47deaf72a1c67b8ab25.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/cf081611-1f2d-429d-bcaf-7f91ad592095/to/2994a6e3-d37f-4bb7-b8d7-d3db06a72ed0) against commit fd7df666f1587c9294d5d364519b088b2f3fb790:

[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13170595518)

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21544~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@erdOne The main result of #20096 is proven here.

This seems like a regression. Do you understand how this is connected to the rest of the PR?
At the face of it, this lemma looks like a good simp lemma.
Oh, I made an adjustment in #21544 that made this no longer necessary, but I forgot to revert this change.

Should this be a simp lemma?
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem jacobson_quotient_jacobson : jacobson R (M ‚ß∏ jacobson R M) = ‚ä• := by
```

Idem
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem jacobson_quotient_jacobson : jacobson (R ‚ß∏ jacobson R) = ‚ä• :=
```
This comment gives an equivalent condition for a ring to be artinian, but the theorem below *assumes* that `R` is artinian...

The "if" part holds more generally by [isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/FiniteLength.html#isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian). How about
```suggestion
@[stacks 00JB "A ring is Artinian if and only if it has finite length as a module over itself.
(For the "if" part, see `isFiniteLength_iff_isNoetherian_isArtinian`.)
Any such ring is both Artinian and Noetherian."]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory): Hopkins‚ÄìLevitzki theorem

`- instance (R) [CommRing R] [IsArtinianRing R] (I : Ideal R) : IsArtinianRing (R ‚ß∏ I)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2994a6e3-d37f-4bb7-b8d7-d3db06a72ed0) for commit cfe9acc75a8355b45f16a47deaf72a1c67b8ab25.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/cf081611-1f2d-429d-bcaf-7f91ad592095/to/2994a6e3-d37f-4bb7-b8d7-d3db06a72ed0) against commit fd7df666f1587c9294d5d364519b088b2f3fb790:
```diff

+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Killing      instructions    -5.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.RootSystem   instructions    -6.7%
```
